Reason: The 'cached_rows_fail_threshold' configuration is performance-sensitive. This is because it directly affects the behavior of the system in resolving potentially 'out-of-date' rows with replica filtering protection. The configuration is used as a parameter in the ReplicaFilteringProtection constructor, which plays a crucial role in ensuring data consistency by querying replicas. The threshold set by this configuration determines when the system considers cached replica rows to be failed, impacting the number of queries made to replicas and potentially causing system load variations. Therefore, the configuration involves performance-related operations that are time-expensive and memory-expensive within the related code, leading to notable performance variations at the system level.
